roleset.name: put in a particular location, or describe

role.descr: location or position, or attribute of arg1

example.name: verbal
example.text: One investment banker said [Mr. Steinberg]-1 may be trying *trace*-1 to position himself as a friendly investor who could help UAL Chairman Stephen Wolf revive a failed labor-management bid.
example.arg: as a friendly investor who could help UAL Chairman Stephen Wolf revive a failed labor-management bid.

example.name: adjectival, sorta
example.text: He attributed the unusually high volume to broad-based selling on fears that the Thatcher government may be in turmoil and [Britain's Labor Party]-1 positioned *trace*-1 to regain control of the government and renew efforts at nationalization.
example.arg: to regain control of the government and renew efforts at nationalization.

example.name: Arg0,1,2
example.text: It is exactly because of his positioning himself as a comedian with no agenda, or with and agenda that is decidedly apolitical, that Jon Stewart was given the credit and trust by most people who claim that they hate politics and distrust all politicians.
example.arg: as a comedian with no agenda, or with and agenda that is decidedly apolitical,

roleset.note: POSITION-V NOTES: The latter example actually effectively has S[ NP[ Britain's LaborParty] VP[ regain control...]]. Damn those ECM verbs already! (from position.01-v)
